alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 5:13PM CDT until May 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... James River at Galena affecting Stone County. James River NEAR Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. Current River near Powder Mill affecting Carter and Shannon Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Galena. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Approximate level which floods Hootentown Access and Campground. At 17.5 feet, Flood waters reach the second window level of the restrooms at the James River Outfitter Canoe Park area. (938.5 FT MSL) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 9.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on or before Saturday afternoon at 515 PM CDT.
